text: The Sudbury Basin was formed by an asteroid impact 1.8 billion years ago.
Goosebumps are a vestigial response from hairy ancestors.
The Manicouagan Reservoir is a visible impact crater from space.
Wisdom teeth are becoming less common in humans.
Shatter cones are evidence of ancient impacts.
The appendix may be a vestigial organ.
Tektites are glassy rocks formed by meteor impacts.
The coccyx is a remnant of a tail.
Impactites form when rock is melted by impacts.
Humans once had a third eyelid.
The KT boundary marks the dinosaur extinction.
Arrector pili muscles cause goosebumps.
Iridium is rare on Earth but common in asteroids.
The palmaris longus muscle is absent in 14% of people.
The Deccan Traps may have contributed to dinosaur extinction.
Darwin's tubercle is a vestigial ear feature.
The Siberian Traps caused the largest mass extinction.
The plantaris muscle is vestigial in humans.
Flood basalts cover millions of square kilometers.
The pyramidalis muscle is absent in 20% of people.
The Columbia River Basalt Group covers Washington state.
Male nipples are vestigial structures.
Hotspots create volcanic island chains.
Hiccups may be a remnant from amphibian ancestors.
The Hawaiian Islands formed over a hotspot.
The pharyngeal arches develop into neck structures.
Yellowstone sits on a supervolcano hotspot.
Human embryos temporarily have tails.
The Iceland hotspot created the Mid-Atlantic Ridge.
Lanugo is fetal hair humans once kept.
The RÃ©union hotspot may have caused the Deccan Traps.
The vomeronasal organ is vestigial in humans.
Mantle plumes rise from near the core.
Humans have genes for making vitamin C but they're broken.
The D" layer is at the base of the mantle.
Olfactory receptor genes are mostly non-functional in humans.
The inner core is solid iron and nickel.
Humans have lost the ability to make 1 of 20 amino acids.
The outer core is liquid iron and nickel.
Humans cannot biosynthesize vitamin B12.
The Moho discontinuity separates crust from mantle.
GULO gene is broken in humans, causing need for vitamin C.
P-waves travel faster than S-waves.
Humans have 3 billion base pairs in their genome.
S-waves cannot travel through liquids.
Only 1.5% of human DNA codes for proteins.
The shadow zone proves Earth has a liquid outer core.
Humans have about 20,000 protein-coding genes.
Love waves cause the most earthquake damage.
Transposons make up 45% of the human genome.
Rayleigh waves move in elliptical patterns.
Mitochondrial DNA is inherited only from mothers.
The Richter scale is logarithmic.
Y chromosome DNA is inherited only from fathers.
The moment magnitude scale replaced the Richter scale.
Humans and chimpanzees share 98.8% of DNA.
The largest recorded earthquake was magnitude 9.5 in Chile.
Humans and mice share 85% of protein-coding genes.
Japan has the most earthquake monitoring stations.
Humans and fruit flies share 60% of genes.
The San Andreas Fault is 800 miles long.
Humans have 23 pairs of chromosomes.
The Cascadia Subduction Zone threatens the Pacific Northwest.
Chromosome 1 is the largest human chromosome.
Subduction zones produce the largest earthquakes.
Chromosome 21 is the smallest autosome.
The Ring of Fire has 75% of Earth's volcanoes.
The Y chromosome is one of the smallest.
There are about 1,350 potentially active volcanoes.
Telomeres shorten with each cell division.
Mauna Loa is the largest volcano on Earth.
Telomerase can extend telomeres.
Mount Tambora's eruption caused the Year Without a Summer.
Cancer cells have abnormal telomerase activity.
Krakatoa's explosion was heard 3,000 miles away.
CRISPR can edit genes with high precision.
Mount St. Helens erupted in 1980.
Cas9 is the enzyme that cuts DNA in CRISPR.
Pompeii was buried by Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD.
Guide RNA directs CRISPR to the target gene.
Volcanic lightning occurs during eruptions.
PCR amplifies DNA exponentially.
Lahars are volcanic mudflows.
DNA sequencing has become 100 million times cheaper.
Pyroclastic flows can travel at 450 mph.
The Human Genome Project took 13 years.
Lava tubes can be miles long.
Sanger sequencing reads one DNA strand at a time.
Pahoehoe lava has a smooth, ropy surface.
Next-gen sequencing reads millions of strands at once.
Aa lava has a rough, jagged surface.
Oxford Nanopore can sequence DNA in real-time.
Obsidian is volcanic glass.
23andMe uses DNA microarrays.
Pumice is the only rock that floats.
SNPs are single nucleotide changes.
Geysers erupt when groundwater is heated by magma.
Indels are insertions or deletions in DNA.
Old Faithful erupts about every 90 minutes.
Copy number variants affect large DNA segments.
